Tucson Prime knew how to fall without causing major injuries to himself, an=
d seems to roll into the sink hole with knees firmly tucked into his chest.=
  Once he reaches the hole he finds himself safely in the hole, back first,=
 and then rolls up to his feet, with just a few dents in his armor.  He dus=
ts himself off the best he can and lends a pair of high beams to light the =
way safely for Rodimus, hoping that he too would not have such a hard fall.=


"Rodimus?  Are you all right?"

Night Shift does the same drop and roll m=
aneuver and rolls quickly back to his feet. He too puts on the high beams t=
o get himself a look around.

" Slag.  Well, at least I didn't fall as hard=
 as those scrap heads thought I would.  Hah!  I owe that ta Ninjabot traini=
ng.  Hmm, gettn' outa here's gonna be a different story all tagether."

He =
now gets his connection com link over to Tucson Prime.

" So what'dya make =
of this one, Tucson Prime."

Tucson Prime responds as he too examines the d=
irt and consistancy of the sink hole's materials.

" Well, they out did the=
mselves this time, I'll give them that.  This is volcanic soil, rather slip=
pery, and I'm not too fond of the odor either."

Night Shift responds.

"Co=
py that, worse than a busted exhaust system.  Ain't no way we're gettn' out=
a here the easy way.  Now, if I were Prowl, what would I do?"

Tucson raise=
s a brow.

"That's a good question Night Shift.  One I should ask myself.  =
There is a way out, although not easy to find, but there is a way out of th=
is.  We just have to dig deeper into our logic and find the answer.  And ge=
tting angry isn't going to do us any good."

Night Shift nodds.

" Yeah, yo=
u're right, so far it isn't.  Wait a minute, what about that climbn' trick =
he taught us?  The one we practiced for days on end?"

Tucson raises a brow=
.

" Yes, that one.  Might not work but it's worth an attempt."

From where=
 they were, Tucson and Night Shift now attempt a special climbinb maneuver =
which they were taught by Prowl, by using every inch of their body, like an=
 upside down spider, and slowly move one limb at a time, keeping hands and =
feet firmly against the walls of their ditches.

Meanwhile outside, Rat Tra=
p and Quick Stride think it's best to remain beside Legacy and not venture =
out ahead of him.  Rat Trap sniffs the air and doesn't like what his tiny n=
ose picks up.

"Uhh ohhh...  Ummm, I don't think things are workn' out too =
well in there..."

Quickstride also looks concerned.

" Normally, I don't h=
esitate to do something but, I got a baaaaad feeln' in my servos on this on=
e Legacy.  I - think we better just follow you.  Yeah, that's right, it's t=
he safest thing ta do."

him. Legacy is going to open an escape path for us. But first, it's about t=
ime I won our side some pay back."

oked at Tuscon, his jaw dropping!

r cover the battle scene, but

eavily stacked against

eds to step in.

=

> >

want to take the Autobots down, you'll have to get past me first, Cyclonus!=
 And this time, I'm not holding anything back!"
>

con as he turned to face him, "Then it is as I
> hoped." he said, bowing hi=
s head slightly at the new prime, his optics
> never leaving Tuscon's - the=
 gesture of one warrior to another.
> 
> > Night Shift reports to Legacy, L=
ord Elder,Rat Trap, Lord Perseus, and Quickstride.
> >
> > "Yo, Night Shift=
 here, I'm broadcastn' from Ninjabot Radio Network, you're missn' some real=
 hot tension buildn' up in here. I think Tucson Prime's sick of Cyclonus's =
scrap and he's lookn' ta go one on one ta show 'em what he's really made of=
. I ain't never seen 'em this steamed off but slag, he's got a look in his =
face like he's itchn' ta do some major damage. Maybe you'll get in here jus=
t in time ta take advantage of some newly fallen spare parts.. Maybe, that'=
s if there are any."
> 
> Legacy's cold voice intoned over the communicatio=
n grid, "Illogical.
> The situation that you are in is repleate with unknow=
n variables and
> permutations. To deduce a victory with such an unstable s=
et of
> parameters illogical and extremely dangerous."  Legacy paused as th=
e
> sounds of explosions could be heard in the background, "I will be
> the=
re momentarily."
> 
> > " This is it Rodimus, this is where our tables are =
going to turn, and then, we will make these Predacons and Decepticons eat t=
heir words. We aren't going to run, we're going to fight and we're going to=
 give it our all! AUTOBOTS, MAXIMALS, ASSUME YOUR BATTLE MODES AT THIS TIME=
 AND ERECT ALL SHIELDS SURROUNDING THE OLD MAXIMAL BASE AND THE ARK! WE WIL=
L PROTECT OUR OWN AND VANQUISH OUR ENEMIES! WE'RE GOING TO TAKE BACK THIS P=
LANET AND TURN THINGS AROUND FOR THE INNOCENT! THIS FIGHT IS FOR FREEDOM, N=
OT POWER, AND WE WILL TAKE IT BACK!"
> 
> Rodimus nodded as well as he turn=
ed to face the oncoming seemingly
> endless hoard of Decepticons and Predac=
ons, "We stand together then
> Tuscon." he said, trying to sound more confi=
dent than he was. he knew
> the odds, even without Legacy's cautious wordin=
g. Rodimus' weapon was
> growing quite warm in his hand with the repeated u=
se it was getting.
> 
> > He waits with anticipation. Inside Tucson Prime p=
auses for just one moment, and then with almost a roar in his voice..
> >
>=
 > "AUTOBOTS, MAXIMALS, ATTACK!"
> >
> > Inside, Tucson Prime throws a powe=
rful punch and launches one of his large missiles from his missile carrier,=
 attempting to open fire on the enemy to shake them up a bit. Night Shift a=
ttempts to do the same with his photon blast riffle.
> >
> > " That's right=
, you be messn' with the wrong bots slag balls!"

and light errupt through the halls as Tuscion's
> missiles fly through the =
air. However the missles failed to reach

all rockets flew through the air from

issles prematurely.

said another cold
> voice as Jhiaxus stood thier in the midst of the smoke =
and debris from
> the missile, the anti missile defence obviously of his do=
ing. "You
> have lost Tuscon Prime." Jhiaxus said, his voice all confidence=
 as he
> brought his own weapon to bear. He smiled at Rodimus, "And soon yo=
u
> both will be among the Predacon ranks! Bwhahahhaa!!!!"
> 
> Meanwhile a=
s the others fight it out, Nightrazor shimmered and
> appeared next to Dark=
hawk and behind Nightshift! What he was about to
> do was difficult to tell=
, because instead of completing the move the
> floor beneath his feet began=
 to rumble as large cracks ran through the
> entire hallway!
> 
> It would =
seem that these hallways were not designed to take on the
> full brunt of t=
wo primes and several leader class Predecaons,
> Decepticons and other vari=
ous soldiers. So the wall shuddered and
> spilt as finally the floor gave w=
ay, sending the entire section of
> hall plunging downward nearly 60' into =
a large open cavern!
> 
> The cavern was incredibly large, the cieling reac=
hing up nearly the
> entire distance back to the black Fortress above it. T=
his chamber
> looks to be totally unused, an natural chamber that shifted i=
tself
> under the fortress over the course of time. The chamber itself is h=
ot,
> the smell of sulpher and ash can be detected. The fact that this room=

> is not filled with searing, superheated liquid stone is miraculous.
> Ho=
wever it is obvious that too much firepower in this room would bring
> tons=
 of it pouring into this area at a moment's notice!
> 
> There do not appea=
r to be any exits from this room save the one above,
> although a brave sou=
l could perhaps try to make one . . . and risk
> bring in the magma that mo=
st likely surrounds this room.
> 
> 60 feet above the chamber Legacy finall=
y made it to the room above and
> screeches to a halt. He sends his scanner=
s peering downward, "A most
> interesting development." he said as he consi=
dered what to do to help.
